alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 2:34AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Including the following areas, Deltana and Tanana Flats and Middle Tanana Valley. * WHEN...Until 315 PM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected over low-lying areas along the Tanana River, and along old sloughs near the river. Flooding is possible at Whitestone Farms, but river levels have started to fall in the area. Flooding is expected at the Rosie Creek Subdivision near Fairbanks, where water levels are expected to rise today and flood Perkins Drive and Melanie Lane. Flooding in the Rosie Creek area is expected to be about 1 ft lower than what occurred in 2020. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 234 AM AKDT, High water on the Tanana River, combined with heavy rain that occurred south of Salcha on Sunday night and Monday, and additional rain expected today, and Friday into Saturday, is expected to cause minor flooding along the Tanana River. Water levels are now bankfull and are expected to rise today and remain high through the weekend. Water levels near Delta Junction are expected to fall starting Wednesday night. Tanana river gage readings at Delta Junction continued to fall overnight, but are expected to rise today to near flood stage. Tanana River gage readings at Fairbanks are at bankfull and expected to rise through today, and crest just above flood stage. Water is expected remain high near Fairbanks through the weekend. - For Tanana River at Big Delta: At 11:55pm Tuesday the stage was 21.23 feet. Flood Stage is 23.0 feet. For Tanana River at Fairbanks: At 1:15am Wednesday the stage was 24.4 feet. Flood Stage is 24.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 24.7 feet is expected around 4:00am Thursday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.

area.areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley
